title: Day 3
message:
**Functions and Loops**

javascript uses alot of functions to do replicable tasks. 

DRY  -- DONT REPEAT YOURSELF

arrays -- hold values in zero-indexed lists
							uses square brackets \[\]
							accessing the array by brackets
							
							
objects -- hold values in key/value pairs.
							uses curly braces \{\}
							accessing the object by bracket and          dot
							
							
Properties and Methods of Collections
Array 

**Function**

a block of code you can reuse.

what is a function made of:
1. Name
2. Params/args
3. Function body (code)
4. return statement

defining and calling functions are different!
we call a function with the name of the function followed by ().


Defining Functions
function name(parameter) \{
		function body
		function body
		return statement
\}

Calling a Function
name(arguments)


function declaration

function name(parameter)\{\}

Function expressions
const name = function(parameter)\{\}


**Loops**

a built-in construct of javascript that allows us to repeat an action.

what is a loop made of
1. Start condition
2. Stop condition
3. Increment
4. Code Block
